With the recent changes to devstack and the migration
of the trove utility 'redstack' to 'trovestack' a number
of unnecessary items were brought over.  This change
attempts to fix some problems and clean up some issues:

 - Environment variables are ignored.
 - The openstack client is used wherever possible.
 - Credentials are taken from the clouds.yaml file or
   sourced from the devstack/accrc/{project}/{user} directory.
   This means that authentication is now done through the
   mechanism specified by devstack.
   This should fix the kick-start and clean issues.
 - References to stable/<branch> have been removed.
 - The trove devstack plugin is assumed to be in the trove repo.
 - Sourcing /tmp/integration/env.rc has been removed (items in
   this file can be moved to ~/.trovestack.options.rc if needed).
 - set_home_dir was removed.
 - The fault flavors no longer set up 'resize' versions of themselves.
 - Help for int-tests was improved to add scenario examples.

This should fix the issues people may have been having with
'kick-start' giving an authentication error after sourcing the
openrc file or 'clean' not running properly.  There should be
no more 'plugin already enabled' style errors either.

Change-Id: Ib9af99c37f6729e4e91114a8032732d23a3e0850

commit_message:
Clean up trovestack utility (fix kick-start)

With the recent changes to devstack and the migration
of the trove utility 'redstack' to 'trovestack' a number
of unnecessary items were brought over.  This change
attempts to fix some problems and clean up some issues:

 - Environment variables are ignored.
 - Credentials are taken from the clouds.yaml file or
   sourced from the devstack/accrc/{project}/{user} directory.
   This means that authentication is now done through the
   mechanism specified by devstack.
   This should fix the kick-start and clean issues.
 - The openstack client is used wherever possible with the
   same set of credentials as mentioned above.
 - References to stable/<branch> have been removed.
 - The trove devstack plugin is assumed to be in the trove repo.
 - Sourcing /tmp/integration/env.rc has been removed (items in
   this file can be moved to ~/.trovestack.options.rc if needed).
 - set_home_dir was removed.
 - The fault flavors no longer set up 'resize' versions of themselves.
 - Help for int-tests was improved to add scenario examples and
   a few other minor clarifications.

This should fix the issues people may have been having with
'kick-start' giving an authentication error after sourcing the
openrc file or 'clean' not running properly.  There should be
no more 'plugin already enabled' style errors either.

Note: The original code for switching to V3 of authentication was
removed as it wasn't an issue with kick-start/clean up per se.
It still should be fixed, but as a separate set of changes.

Change-Id: Ib9af99c37f6729e4e91114a8032732d23a3e0850
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/10/407210/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Make sure we're not affected by the local environment unset OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_ID unset OS_REGION_NAME unset OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID unset OS_PROJECT_NAME unset OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION unset OS_PASSWORD unset OS_AUTH_URL unset OS_USERNAME unset OS_TENANT_NAME unset OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION unset OS_NO_CACHE TROVE_DEVSTACK_SETTINGS="$DEST/trove/devstack/settings" TROVE_DEVSTACK_PLUGIN="$DEST/trove/devstack/plugin.sh" local FLAVOR_SKIP_RESIZE=${6:-""} credentials="--os-cloud=devstack-admin" FLAVOR_LIST_FOR_ADD=$(openstack $credentials flavor list | cut -d'|' -f3 | sed -e's/ /,/g') id=${id}e id=${id}r if [[ -z ${FLAVOR_SKIP_RESIZE} || ${name} == ${reg_name} ]]; then openstack $credentials flavor create $name --id $id --ram $memory --disk $FLAVOR_ROOT_GB --vcpus $vcpus --ephemeral $ephemeral fi openstack --os-cloud=devstack-admin $1 list | grep " $2" | get_field $3 local credentials="--os-cloud=devstack-admin" add_flavor 'fault_1' 30 512 1 1 'skip_resize' add_flavor 'fault_2' 31 131072 5 1 'skip_resize' local credentials="--os-cloud=devstack-admin" GLANCE_IMAGEIDS=$(openstack $credentials image list | grep $(basename $IMAGE_URL .qcow2) | get_field 1) openstack $credentials image delete $GLANCE_IMAGEIDS GLANCE_IMAGEID=`get_glance_id upload_image $IMAGE_URL` source "$TROVE_DEVSTACK_SETTINGS" source /dev/stdin < <(sed -n '/^function start_trove\(\)/,/^}/p' "$TROVE_DEVSTACK_PLUGIN") source "$TROVE_DEVSTACK_SETTINGS" source /dev/stdin < <(sed -n '/^function stop_trove\(\)/,/^}/p' "$TROVE_DEVSTACK_PLUGIN") local project_name=${1:-alt_demo} exclaim "Cleaning up project '${COLOR_BLUE}${project_name}${COLOR_NONE}'" if [[ ! -f "${PATH_DEVSTACK_SRC}"/accrc/${project_name}/admin ]]; then echo "Could not find credentials file for project '${project_name}'" exit 1 fi source "${PATH_DEVSTACK_SRC}"/accrc/${project_name}/admin local credentials="--os-cloud=devstack-admin" exec_cmd_on_output "openstack $credentials server list" "openstack $credentials server delete" 5 exec_cmd_on_output "openstack $credentials volume list" "openstack $credentials volume delete" 1 exec_cmd_on_output "openstack $credentials security group list" "openstack $credentials security group delete" 0 "default" exec_cmd_on_output "openstack $credentials server group list" "openstack $credentials server group delete" local credentials="--os-cloud=devstack-admin" SWIFT_ENDPOINTS=$(openstack $credentials endpoint list --service swift -c ID -f value) openstack $credentials endpoint create swift public 'http://'$CONTROLLER_IP':8080/v1/AUTH_$(tenant_id)s' --region RegionOne openstack $credentials endpoint create swift internal 'http://'$CONTROLLER_IP':8080/v1/AUTH_$(tenant_id)s' --region RegionOne openstack $credentials endpoint create swift admin 'http://'$CONTROLLER_IP':8080' --region RegionOne echo $SWIFT_ENDPOINTS | xargs -n 1 openstack $credentials endpoint delete start - Start or resume Trove daemons. stop - Kill Trove daemons. See trove/tests/int_tests.py for list of registered groups. Examples: Run original MySQL tests: ./trovestack int-tests Run all MySQL scenario tests: ./trovestack int-tests --group=mysql-supported Run single Redis scenario tests: ./trovestack int-tests --group=redis-supported-single Run specific functional tests: ./trovestack int-tests --group=module-create --group=configuration-create clean - Clean up resources created by a failed test run. Takes project_name as an optional parameter (defaults to alt_demo).
deleted_lines: # Source the old-style localrc, or new-style .local.auto - only one should exist. # Note: The devstack localrc's have references to 'enable_plugin' which causes # errors when sourcing them in the stable/juno and stable/kilo branches. # These errors are safe to ignore when sourcing these files. set +e [[ -f $PATH_DEVSTACK_SRC/$LOCALRC ]] && source $PATH_DEVSTACK_SRC/$LOCALRC [[ -f $PATH_DEVSTACK_SRC/$LOCALRC_AUTO ]] && source $PATH_DEVSTACK_SRC/$LOCALRC_AUTO set -e TROVE_AUTH_ENDPOINT=$KEYSTONE_AUTH_PROTOCOL://$KEYSTONE_AUTH_HOST:$KEYSTONE_AUTH_PORT/v2.0# Allow sourcing config values from env.rc for overrides if [ -f /tmp/integration/env.rc ]; then source /tmp/integration/env.rc fi # Set the location of the Trove setup commands file for devstack - either in # the devstack repo, or the Trove one. Also sets the flag which activates the # devstack trove plugin, if required. We'll use the devstack version if it # exists, otherwise we assume the plugin method. function set_trove_plugin_vars () { FAIL_IF_MISSING=${1:-true} TROVE_SETUP_CMD_FILE="$PATH_DEVSTACK_SRC/lib/trove" if [ -f "$TROVE_SETUP_CMD_FILE" ]; then USE_DEVSTACK_TROVE_PLUGIN=false else TROVE_SETUP_CMD_FILE="$DEST/trove/devstack/plugin.sh" USE_DEVSTACK_TROVE_PLUGIN=true fi # Only complain if we have a devstack directory and are told to if [ "$FAIL_IF_MISSING" = "true" ] && [ -d "$PATH_DEVSTACK_SRC" ] && [ ! -f "$TROVE_SETUP_CMD_FILE" ]; then exclaim "${COLOR_RED}Trove setup file '${TROVE_SETUP_CMD_FILE}' not found!${COLOR_NONE}" exit 1 fi } function set_home_dir() { exclaim "set_home_dir has been nooped." exit 1 } credentials="--os-username=admin --os-password=$ADMIN_PASSWORD --os-tenant-name=admin --os-auth-url=$TROVE_AUTH_ENDPOINT" FLAVOR_LIST_FOR_ADD=$(nova $credentials flavor-list | cut -d'|' -f3 | sed -e's/ /,/g') if [[ $BRANCH_OVERRIDE == "stable/juno" || $BRANCH_OVERRIDE == "stable/kilo" ]]; then id=1${id} else id=${id}e fi if [[ $BRANCH_OVERRIDE == "stable/juno" || $BRANCH_OVERRIDE == "stable/kilo" ]]; then id=2${id} else id=${id}r fi nova $credentials flavor-create $name $id $memory $FLAVOR_ROOT_GB $vcpus --ephemeral $ephemeral openstack --os-auth-url=$TROVE_AUTH_ENDPOINT --os-username=admin --os-password=$ADMIN_PASSWORD --os-project-name=admin $1 list | grep " $2" | get_field $3 set_trove_plugin_vars false local credentials="--os-username=admin --os-password=$ADMIN_PASSWORD --os-tenant-name=admin --os-auth-url=$TROVE_AUTH_ENDPOINT --os-region $REGION_NAME" add_flavor 'fault_1' 30 512 1 1 add_flavor 'fault_2' 31 131072 5 1 local credentials="--os-username=admin --os-password=$ADMIN_PASSWORD --os-tenant-name=admin --os-auth-url=$TROVE_AUTH_ENDPOINT --os-region $REGION_NAME" TOKEN=$(openstack $credentials token issue | grep ' id ' | get_field 2) GLANCE_IMAGEIDS=$(glance $credentials image-list | grep $(basename $IMAGE_URL .qcow2) | get_field 1) glance $credentials image-delete $GLANCE_IMAGEIDS GLANCE_IMAGEID=`get_glance_id upload_image $IMAGE_URL $TOKEN` set_trove_plugin_vars source /dev/stdin < <(sed -n '/^function start_trove\(\)/,/^}/p' "$TROVE_SETUP_CMD_FILE") set_trove_plugin_vars source /dev/stdin < <(sed -n '/^function stop_trove\(\)/,/^}/p' "$TROVE_SETUP_CMD_FILE") echo "Cleaning up project '${OS_PROJECT_NAME}'" source "${PATH_DEVSTACK_SRC}"/openrc admin "${OS_PROJECT_NAME}" exec_cmd_on_output "nova list" "nova delete" 5 exec_cmd_on_output "cinder list" "cinder delete" 1 exec_cmd_on_output "openstack security group list" "openstack security group delete" 0 "default" exec_cmd_on_output "nova server-group-list" "nova server-group-delete" if [[ $BRANCH_OVERRIDE == "stable/liberty" ]]; then # Devstack in liberty doesn't copy the clouds.yaml file to /etc so we need to # ensure we have access to the clouds.yaml file set up by devstack-gate sudo mkdir -p ~/.config/openstack sudo ln -s $DEST/.config/openstack/clouds.yaml ~/.config/openstack/clouds.yaml sudo chown -R $(whoami) ~/.config fi source $DEST/devstack/accrc/admin/admin # NOTE(mriedem): We have to treat stable branches before liberty special # due to constraints with older versions of python-openstackclient. if [[ $BRANCH_OVERRIDE == "stable/juno" || $BRANCH_OVERRIDE == "stable/kilo" ]]; then SWIFT_ENDPOINT=$(openstack endpoint list | grep 'swift' | get_field 1) openstack endpoint create swift --region RegionOne --publicurl 'http://'$CONTROLLER_IP':8080/v1/AUTH_$(tenant_id)s' \ --internalurl 'http://'$CONTROLLER_IP':8080/v1/AUTH_$(tenant_id)s' --adminurl 'http://'$CONTROLLER_IP':8080' openstack endpoint delete $SWIFT_ENDPOINT else OS_CLIENT_ARGS="--os-auth-type v3password --os-auth-url $KEYSTONE_AUTH_PROTOCOL://$KEYSTONE_AUTH_HOST:5000/v3 --os-identity-api-version=3" SWIFT_ENDPOINTS=$(openstack endpoint list $OS_CLIENT_ARGS --service swift -c ID -f value) openstack endpoint create $OS_CLIENT_ARGS swift public 'http://'$CONTROLLER_IP':8080/v1/AUTH_$(tenant_id)s' --region RegionOne openstack endpoint create $OS_CLIENT_ARGS swift internal 'http://'$CONTROLLER_IP':8080/v1/AUTH_$(tenant_id)s' --region RegionOne openstack endpoint create $OS_CLIENT_ARGS swift admin 'http://'$CONTROLLER_IP':8080' --region RegionOne echo $SWIFT_ENDPOINTS | xargs -n 1 openstack endpoint delete $OS_CLIENT_ARGS fi# set_home_dirset_trove_plugin_vars false start - Start or resume daemons Trove depends on. stop - Kill daemons Trove depends on. clean - Clean up resources created by a failed test run.

commit_message:
Stop caching client to fix long-running test fails

If a node is really slow then a single test can take longer than an
hour. It will then fail as the client it has cached will now have an
expired token. To alleviate this, the caching of the clients was removed
(since the time saved on caching the clients is probably negligible
anyway).

Checking the client code was also cleaned up for a number of tests.

The cluster tests were modified, however the code was reverted as
there is no way to test it at present (they will not run as they
haven't been modified to work with the new neutron set up).  This
will be fixed in a separate changereq (since they are currently not
being tested in the gate, this should not hold up development).

Change-Id: I63d5b78084486b806bff38068260e42128c0d0ed
Closes-Bug: 1647002

subject: Network test: rework the service types/service providers tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-21 15:35:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/f35802773c7e4a3d8d018de8647f5e05f4f5915d', 'message': "Unskip a test because the related bug is fixed

We skipped test_service_provider_list because of bug #1400370 but
it's now fixed.

Change-Id: I66a077b61aa260bf0acaae1adf77f44104b67f0e
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-25 16:02:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/db3515fbf85db401cf6168870b00ed599d330702', 'message': "Network test: rework the service types/service providers tests

The test `test_service_provider` has been skip for more than 2 years
because of bug #1400370 . In the mean time, the Neutron service-type
extension has been reworked heavily.

The connection between service-types and service-providers from the
documentation PoV is briefly discussed in bug #1239153

What's left in the Neutron Core API is 'GET /service-providers'
as per the official doc here [1]

The patch adds the test for the corresponding API route.

[1] : http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/index.html?
expanded=list-service-providers-detail#service-providers

Change-Id: I66a077b61aa260bf0acaae1adf77f44104b67f0e

commit_message:
Network test: rework the service types/service providers tests

The test `test_service_provider` has been skip for more than 2 years
because of bug #1400370 . In the mean time, the Neutron service-type
extension has been reworked heavily.

The connection between service-types and service-providers from the
documentation PoV is briefly discussed in bug #1239153

What's left in the Neutron Core API is 'GET /service-providers'
as per the official doc here [1]

The patch adds the test for the corresponding API route.

[1] : http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/index.html?
expanded=list-service-providers-detail#service-providers

Related-Bug: #1400370
Change-Id: I66a077b61aa260bf0acaae1adf77f44104b67f0e

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/a4fedf7cf7843d87f401dc8287402074

Change-Id: If94616f3559d8b53f952f3424fa322fb692f0cd6

commit_message:
Remove deprecated "shred" option for volume_clear

Cinder removed the shred option for "volume_clear" in Ocata, it
performed the same actions as the "zero" option.

Change-Id: Iacad9f6e23effabc9baf0d5995d1c287cb1163cb

deleted_lines: # (StrOpt) Method used to wipe old volumes (valid options are: none, zero, # shred) cinder_volume_clear: shred

commit_message:
Move mistral for authtoken

Switch keystone_authtoken parameters for the new class
mistral::keystone::authtoken to configure the keystone_authtoken
section in mistral.conf.

Some deprecations:
- mistral::auth_uri is deprecated in favor of
  mistral::keystone::authtoken::auth_uri.
- mistral::identity_uri is deprecated in favor of
  mistral::keystone::authtoken::auth_url.
- mistral::keystone_user is deprecated in favor of
  mistral::keystone::authtoken::username.
- mistral::keystone_tenant is deprecated in favor of
  mistral::keystone::authtoken::project_name.
- mistral::keystone_password is deprecated in favor of
  mistral::keystone::authtoken::password.

Change-Id: I051f39ef6c0e78bc7dd23b6183b329e7f4d7fde8
Closes-bug: #1604463

commit_message:
Additional checks for nova scenarios

Patch adds verification of resuls of creation and list actions.
Patch contains changes in both scenarios and unit tests and affect on following
scenarios:
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/aggregates.create_and_list_aggregates
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/flavors.create_and_list_flavors
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/floating_ips_bulk.create_and_list_floating_ips_bulk
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/keypairs.create_and_list_keypairs
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/networks.create_and_list_networks
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/security_group.create_and_list_secgroups
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/servers.create_and_list_server

Files 'nova.utils' and 'rally.task.functional' (including unit tests) were also modified

Change-Id: Ie17c9127a5a3bab499714f20ddbc7ab08b8dd45b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/02/402102/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from rally import exceptions ips_bulk = self._create_floating_ips_bulk(start_cidr, **kwargs) print(ips_bulk) if not ips_bulk: msg = ("Bulk of IPS isn't created") raise exceptions.RallyException(msg) list_ips = self._list_floating_ips_bulk() print(list_ips) if len(ips_bulk) <= len(list_ips): if set(ips_bulk) - set(list_ips): msg = ("List of available IPs doesn't contain" " bulk of created IPS\n" "Bulk of IPs: {}\n" "Available IPs: {}").format(ips_bulk, list_ips) raise exceptions.RallyException(msg) return list_ips

Enable mistral dashboard when enable_mistral is yes

Depends-On: I37c73e6304ed005fe019dcdd105c1f333137fa60

Change-Id: I544810afaa5c740f67702ba34e146c19b480de8d
Closes-Bug: #1647267
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/28/406728/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ENABLE_MISTRAL: "{{ 'yes' if enable_mistral | bool else 'no' }}"

'}, {'number': 21, 'created': '2016-11-18 22:18:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-chef-repo/commit/391b88c4a92e15588cd861d75a97be118f48a922', 'message': 'Enables Ubuntu Xenial release (16.04)

- replaces ubuntu14 with ubuntu16
- increments apache2 cookbook to 3.2
- increments apt to 5.0
- increments build-essential to 7.0
- increments database to 6.1
- increments mysql to 8.1
- increments openssl to 6.0
- increments postgresql to 5.1
- increments xfs to 2.0
- increments yum to 3.13
- increments yum-epel to 1.0
- adds openstackclient cookbook
- style fixes to make rubocop happy
- converts smoke tests to python-openstackclient
- tweaks memory limits for multi_node
- corrects ethernet interface naming
- prunes misleading pre-provisioning environment files
- uses atlas for vagrant images
- makes the destroy_all recipe work again

commit_message:
Enables Ubuntu Xenial release (16.04)

- replaces ubuntu14 with ubuntu16
- style fixes to make rubocop happy
- converts smoke tests to python-openstackclient
- tweaks memory limits for multi_node
- corrects ethernet interface naming
- prunes misleading pre-provisioning environment files
- uses atlas for vagrant images
- makes the destroy_all recipe work again

Change-Id: I79aa5f793614f5430c613dc0b2fc241434fde1f9
Implements: blueprint newton-xenial

commit_message:
[WIP] Block based incremental support - Rsync

Work-in-progress...

Change-Id: I2536da4aa1700fa9ee0a2c48e8a757f422ed499e
Signed-off-by: Ruslan Aliev <raliev@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/23/408223/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Freezer rsync incremental engine Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. """ from freezer.engine.engine import BackupEngine from freezer.engine.rsync import pyrsync import getpass import grp import json import os from oslo_log import log import pwd import Queue import re from six.moves import cStringIO import stat import sys import threading import zlib LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) # Data block size of used by rsync to generate signature RSYNC_BLOCK_SIZE = 4096 # Version of the meta data structure format RSYNC_DATA_STRUCT_VERSION = 1 # Rsync main block size for streams, 32MB (1024*1024*32) RSYNC_BLOCK_BUFF_SIZE = 33554432 # Files type where file data content can be backed up or restored REG_FILE = ('r', 'u') # Dublicate from TAR. PUT ALL THE CONSTANTS in a common file (__init__.py??) DEFAULT_CHUNK_SIZE = 20000000 class RsyncBackupEngine(BackupEngine): def __init__( self, compression_algo, dereference_symlink, exclude, main_storage, is_windows, encrypt_pass_file=None, dry_run=False, chunk_size=DEFAULT_CHUNK_SIZE, incremental_engine='tar'): self.compression_algo = compression_algo self.encrypt_pass_file = encrypt_pass_file self.dereference_symlink = dereference_symlink self.exclude = exclude self._main_storage = main_storage self.is_windows = is_windows self.dry_run = dry_run self.chunk_size = chunk_size self.incremental_engine = incremental_engine @property def main_storage(self): """ :rtype: freezer.storage.storage.Storage :return: """ return self._main_storage def post_backup(self, backup, manifest): self.main_storage.upload_meta_file(backup, manifest) def backup_data(self, backup_path, manifest_path): """Execute backup using rsync algorithm. If an existing rsync meta data is available the backup will be incremental, otherwise will be executed a level 0 backup :param backup_path: :param manifest_path: :return: """ LOG.info("Starting RSYNC engine backup data stream") fs_path = backup_path max_seg_size = self.main_storage.max_segment_size # file_chunk_index = 0 file_read_limit = 0 data_chunk = b'' LOG.info( 'Recursively archiving and compressing files from {}'.format( fs_path)) new_level = manifest_path.split('_')[-1] manifest_name = manifest_path.split('/')[-1] new_meta_prefix = '{}_metadata_{}'.format( self.incremental_engine, self.main_storage.current_backupname_timestamp) if manifest_name.startswith(new_meta_prefix): new_fs_meta = manifest_name else: new_fs_meta = '{}_{}'.format(new_meta_prefix, int(new_level) + 1) rsync_queue = Queue.Queue(maxsize=2) t_get_sign_delta = threading.Thread( target=self.get_sign_delta, args=( fs_path, rsync_queue, self.exclude, manifest_path, new_fs_meta, new_level,)) t_get_sign_delta.daemon = True t_get_sign_delta.start() while True: file_block = rsync_queue.get() if file_block is False: break if len(file_block) == 0: continue data_chunk += file_block file_read_limit += len(file_block) if file_read_limit >= max_seg_size: yield data_chunk data_chunk = b'' file_read_limit = 0 # Upload segments smaller then opt_dict.max_seg_size if len(data_chunk) < max_seg_size: yield data_chunk # Rejoining thread t_get_sign_delta.join() def rsync_gen_delta(self, file_path_fd, old_file_meta): """Get rsync delta for file descriptor provided as arg. :param file_path_fd: :param old_file_meta: :return: """ if not old_file_meta: raise StopIteration # If the ctime or mtime has changed, the delta is computed # data block is returned len_deltas = 0 old_signature = old_file_meta['signature'] # Get changed blocks index only all_changed_indexes = cStringIO() file_path_fd.seek(0) previous_index = -1 modified_blocks = [] for block_index in pyrsync.rsyncdelta( file_path_fd, (old_signature[0], old_signature[1]), RSYNC_BLOCK_SIZE): previous_index += 1 if not isinstance(block_index, int): len_deltas += len(block_index) # previous_index_list.append(str(previous_index)) all_changed_indexes.write(b'\00{}'.format(previous_index)) modified_blocks.append(previous_index) # Yield the total length data changed blocks yield b'\00' + str(len_deltas) previous_index_str = all_changed_indexes.getvalue() + b'\00' len_previous_index_str = len(previous_index_str) + 1 # Yield the length of the string that contain all the indexes yield str(len_previous_index_str) + b'\00' # Yield string containing all the indexes separated by \00 yield previous_index_str # Get blocks of changed data file_path_fd.seek(0) for block_index in modified_blocks: offset = block_index * RSYNC_BLOCK_SIZE file_path_fd.seek(offset) data_block = file_path_fd.read(RSYNC_BLOCK_SIZE) yield data_block @staticmethod def is_file_modified(old_file_meta, file_meta): """Check for changes on inode or file data :param old_file_meta: meta data of the previous backup execution :param file_meta: meta data of the current backup execution :return: True if the file changed, False otherwise """ # Get mtime and ctime from previous backup execution old_file_mtime = old_file_meta['inode']['mtime'] old_file_ctime = old_file_meta['inode']['ctime'] fs_index_file_mtime = file_meta['inode']['mtime'] fs_index_file_ctime = file_meta['inode']['ctime'] # Check if new ctime/mtime is different from the current one file_change_flag = None if old_file_mtime != fs_index_file_mtime: file_change_flag = True elif old_file_ctime != fs_index_file_ctime: file_change_flag = True return file_change_flag def make_reg_file( self, size, file_path, read_pipe, data_chunk, decompress_obj, flushed, level_id): """Create the regular file and write data on it. :param size: :param file_path: :param read_pipe: :param data_chunk: :param decompress_obj: :param flushed: :param level_id: :return: """ # File is created. If size is 0, no content is written and the # function return fd_curr_file = open(file_path, 'a+b') fd_curr_file.seek(0) if level_id == '0000': while size: written_data = min(len(data_chunk), size) fd_curr_file.write(data_chunk[:written_data]) data_chunk = data_chunk[written_data:] size -= written_data if size > 0 and not flushed: try: data_chunk += decompress_obj.decompress( read_pipe.recv_bytes()) except EOFError: LOG.info( "[*] EOF from pipe. Flushing buffer.") data_chunk += decompress_obj.flush() flushed = True continue elif flushed: break elif level_id == '1111': # Searching for: # - the block incremental header string # - len of all the changed blocks # - len of the index string offset_match = re.search(r'^(\00(\d+?)\00(\d+?)\00)', data_chunk) if offset_match: offset_size = len(offset_match.group(1)) len_deltas = int(offset_match.group(2)) len_offset_str = int(offset_match.group(3)) no_of_blocks, reminder = divmod(len_deltas, RSYNC_BLOCK_SIZE) if len_deltas > 0: block_indexes = data_chunk[ offset_size: offset_size + len_offset_str] data_chunk = data_chunk[offset_size + len(block_indexes):] blocks_offsets = filter(None, block_indexes.split('\00')) # Get all the block index offset from for block_index in blocks_offsets: while len(data_chunk) < RSYNC_BLOCK_SIZE: try: data_chunk += decompress_obj.decompress( read_pipe.recv_bytes()) except EOFError: LOG.info( "[*] EOF from pipe. Flushing buffer.") data_chunk += decompress_obj.flush() break offset = int(block_index) * RSYNC_BLOCK_SIZE fd_curr_file.seek(offset) fd_curr_file.write(data_chunk[:RSYNC_BLOCK_SIZE]) data_chunk = data_chunk[RSYNC_BLOCK_SIZE:] if reminder: fd_curr_file.write(data_chunk[:reminder]) data_chunk = data_chunk[reminder:] fd_curr_file.close() return data_chunk def set_inode(self, uname, gname, mtime, name): """Set the file inode fields according to the provided args. :param uname: :param gname: :param mtime: :param name: :return: """ try: current_uid = pwd.getpwnam(uname).pw_uid current_gid = grp.getgrnam(gname).gr_gid os.chown(name, current_uid, current_gid) os.utime(name, (mtime, mtime)) except (IOError, OSError): try: current_uid = pwd.getpwnam(getpass.getuser()).pw_uid current_gid = grp.getgrnam(getpass.getuser()).gr_gid os.chown(name, current_uid, current_gid) os.utime(name, (mtime, mtime)) except (OSError, IOError) as err: raise Exception(err) def get_file_type(self, file_mode, fs_path): """Extract file type from the the file mode retrieved from file abs path :param file_mode: :param fs_path: :return: """ if stat.S_ISREG(file_mode): return 'r', '' if stat.S_ISDIR(file_mode): return 'd', '' if stat.S_ISLNK(file_mode): return 'l', os.readlink(fs_path) if stat.S_ISCHR(file_mode): return 'c', '' if stat.S_ISBLK(file_mode): return 'b', '' if stat.S_ISFIFO(file_mode): return 'p', '' if stat.S_ISSOCK(file_mode): return 's', '' return 'u', '' def restore_level( self, restore_abs_path, read_pipe=None, level=None, dry_run=False): """Restore the provided file into restore_abs_path. Decrypt the file if backup_opt_dict.encrypt_pass_file key is provided. Freezer rsync header data structure: header_len, RSYNC_DATA_STRUCT_VERSION, file_mode, os_stat.st_uid, os_stat.st_gid, os_stat.st_size, mtime, ctime, uname, gname, file_type, linkname :param restore_abs_path: :param read_pipe: :param level: :param dry_run: :return: """ if not os.path.exists(restore_abs_path): raise ValueError( 'Provided restore path does not exist: {0}'.format( restore_abs_path)) # How do we do dry run for rsync backup type? # restore_abs_path == /dev/null?? Can be ok if dry_run: return True # Start loop reading the pipe and pass the data to the tar std input. # If EOFError exception is raised, the loop end the std err will be # checked for errors. decompress_obj = zlib.decompressobj() data_chunk_compressed = read_pipe.recv_bytes() data_chunk = decompress_obj.decompress(data_chunk_compressed) header_str = r'^(\d{1,})\00' flushed = False while True: header_match = re.search(header_str, data_chunk) if not header_match and not flushed: try: data_chunk += decompress_obj.decompress( read_pipe.recv_bytes()) continue except EOFError: LOG.info("EOFError: Pipe closed. Flushing buffer...") data_chunk += decompress_obj.flush() flushed = True if data_chunk and header_match: header_len = int(header_match.group(1)) if header_len > len(data_chunk) and not flushed: try: data_chunk += decompress_obj.decompress( read_pipe.recv_bytes()) except EOFError: LOG.info( "[*] End of File: Pipe closed. Flushing the buffer.") data_chunk += decompress_obj.flush() flushed = True header = data_chunk[:header_len] header_list = header.split('\00') data_chunk = data_chunk[header_len:] data_chunk = self.make_files( header_list, restore_abs_path, read_pipe, data_chunk, dry_run, decompress_obj, flushed, level) else: LOG.info('No more data available...') break def gen_file_header(self, file_path, inode_str_struct): """Generate file header for rsync binary data file :param file_path: file path :param inode_str_struct: file binary string including inode data :return: chunk of binary data to be processed on the next iteration """ start_of_block = b'\00{}\00'.format(file_path) header_size = len(start_of_block) + len(inode_str_struct) header_size += len(str(header_size)) file_header = b'{}{}{}'.format( header_size, start_of_block, inode_str_struct) len_file_header = len(file_header) if header_size != len_file_header: file_header_list = file_header.split('\00') file_header_list = file_header_list[1:] file_header_list.insert(0, str(len_file_header)) file_header = '\00'.join(file_header_list) return file_header def make_files( self, header_list, restore_abs_path, read_pipe, data_chunk, dry_run, decompress_obj, flushed, current_backup_level): """ Header list binary structure: header_len, file_abs_path, RSYNC_DATA_STRUCT_VERSION, file_mode, os_stat.st_uid, os_stat.st_gid, os_stat.st_size, mtime, ctime, uname, gname, file_type, linkname, rsync_block_size, :param header_list: :param restore_abs_path: :param read_pipe: :param data_chunk: :param dry_run: :param decompress_obj: :param flushed: :return: """ # Dry ryn still not implemented if dry_run: raise NotImplementedError('Dry run not yet implemented') # The following commented lines are important for development and # troubleshooting, please let it go :) # header_len = header_list[0] file_path = header_list[1] # data_ver = header_list[2] file_mode = header_list[3] # uid = header_list[4] # gid = header_list[5] size = header_list[6] mtime = header_list[7] # ctime = header_list[8] uname = header_list[9] gname = header_list[10] file_type = header_list[11] link_name = header_list[12] # inumber = header_list[13] # nlink = header_list[14] devminor = header_list[15] devmajor = header_list[16] # rsync_block_size = header_list[17] level_id = header_list[18] # Data format conversion file_mode = int(file_mode) size = int(size) mtime = int(mtime) file_abs_path = '{0}/{1}'.format(restore_abs_path, file_path) if not os.path.isdir(file_abs_path) and \ os.path.exists(file_abs_path) and current_backup_level == 0: os.unlink(file_abs_path) if file_type in REG_FILE: data_chunk = self.make_reg_file( size, file_abs_path, read_pipe, data_chunk, decompress_obj, flushed, level_id) elif file_type == 'd': try: os.makedirs(file_abs_path, file_mode) except (OSError, IOError) as error: LOG.warning( 'Directory {0} creation error: {1}'.format( file_abs_path, error)) elif file_type == 'b': file_mode |= stat.S_IFBLK try: devmajor = int(devmajor) devminor = int(devminor) new_dev = os.makedev(devmajor, devminor) os.mknod(file_abs_path, file_mode, new_dev) except (OSError, IOError) as error: LOG.warning( 'Block file {0} creation error: {1}'.format( file_abs_path, error)) elif file_type == 'c': file_mode |= stat.S_IFCHR try: devmajor = int(devmajor) devminor = int(devminor) new_dev = os.makedev(devmajor, devminor) os.mknod(file_abs_path, file_mode, new_dev) except (OSError, IOError) as error: LOG.warning( 'Character file {0} creation error: {1}'.format( file_abs_path, error)) elif file_type == 'p': try: os.mkfifo(file_abs_path) except (OSError, IOError) as error: LOG.warning( 'FIFO or Pipe file {0} creation error: {1}'.format( file_abs_path, error)) # We need to add support for hard links. # Currently hardlinks are threated as the file they points to. # elif file_type == 'l': # os.link(link_name, file_abs_path) elif file_type == 'l': try: os.symlink(link_name, file_abs_path) except (OSError, IOError) as error: LOG.warning('Link file {0} creation error: {1}'.format( file_abs_path, error)) if file_type != 'l': self.set_inode(uname, gname, mtime, file_abs_path) return data_chunk def get_file_struct(self, fs_path, new_level=0): """Generate file meta data from file abs path. Return the meta data as a dict structure and a binary string {'inode': { 'inumber': os_stat.st_ino, 'nlink': os_stat.st_nlink, 'mode': file_mode, 'uid': os_stat.st_uid, 'gid': os_stat.st_gid, 'size': os_stat.st_size, 'devmajor': os.major(dev), 'devminor': os.minor(dev), 'mtime': mtime, 'ctime': ctime, 'uname': uname, 'gname': gname, 'ftype': file_type, 'lname': lname, 'rsync_block_size': rsync_block_size, 'file_status: status } } :param fs_path: file abs path :return: file data structure """ # Get file inode information, whether the file is a regular # file or a symbolic link try: os_stat = os.lstat(fs_path) except (OSError, IOError) as error: raise Exception('[*] Error on file stat: {}'.format(error)) file_mode = os_stat.st_mode # Get file type. If file type is a link it returns also the # file pointed by the link file_type, lname = self.get_file_type(file_mode, fs_path) # If file_type is a socket return False if file_type == 's': return False, False ctime = int(os_stat.st_ctime) mtime = int(os_stat.st_mtime) uname = pwd.getpwuid(os_stat.st_uid)[0] gname = grp.getgrgid(os_stat.st_gid)[0] dev = os_stat.st_dev inumber = os_stat.st_ino nlink = os_stat.st_nlink uid = os_stat.st_uid gid = os_stat.st_gid size = os_stat.st_size devmajor = os.major(dev) devminor = os.minor(dev) level_id = '0000' if new_level != 0: level_id = '1111' # build file meta data as dictionary inode_dict = { 'inode': { 'inumber': inumber, 'nlink': nlink, 'mode': file_mode, 'uid': uid, 'gid': gid, 'size': size, 'devmajor': devmajor, 'devminor': devminor, 'mtime': mtime, 'ctime': ctime, 'uname': uname, 'gname': gname, 'ftype': file_type, 'lname': lname, 'rsync_block_size': RSYNC_BLOCK_SIZE, #'fstatus': fstatus, 'level_id': level_id} } # build file meta data as binary string inode_bin_str = ( b'{}\00{}\00{}\00{}\00{}' b'\00{}\00{}\00{}\00{}\00{}' b'\00{}\00{}\00{}\00{}\00{}\00{}\00{}').format( RSYNC_DATA_STRUCT_VERSION, file_mode, uid, gid, size, mtime, ctime, uname, gname, file_type, lname, inumber, nlink, devminor, devmajor, RSYNC_BLOCK_SIZE, level_id) return inode_dict, inode_bin_str def get_sign_delta(self, fs_path, write_queue, exclude=None, old_fs_meta=None, new_fs_meta=None, new_level=0): """Compute the file or fs tree path signatures. :param fs_path: :param old_fs_meta: :param new_fs_meta: :param exclude: :param new_level: :return: """ files_meta = { 'files': {}, 'directories': {}, 'meta': { 'broken_links_tot': '', 'total_files': '', 'total_directories': '', 'backup_size_on_disk': '', 'backup_size_uncompressed': '', 'backup_size_compressed': '', 'platform': sys.platform }, 'abs_backup_path': os.getcwd(), 'broken_links': [], 'rsync_struct_ver': RSYNC_DATA_STRUCT_VERSION, 'rsync_block_size': RSYNC_BLOCK_SIZE} backup_size_on_disk = 0 backup_size_compressed = 0 compress_obj = zlib.compressobj(9) # Get old file meta structure or an empty dict if not available old_fs_meta_struct = self.get_fs_meta_struct(old_fs_meta) if os.path.isdir(fs_path): # If given path is a directory, change cwd to path to backup os.chdir(fs_path) for root, dirs, files in os.walk(fs_path): rel_path = os.path.relpath(root, fs_path) # Get file meta struct as dict and binary string inode_dict_struct, inode_str_struct = self.get_file_struct( rel_path, new_level) if inode_dict_struct is False: continue files_meta['directories'][root] = inode_dict_struct backup_size_on_disk += os.path.getsize(rel_path) file_header = self.gen_file_header(rel_path, inode_str_struct) compressed_block = compress_obj.compress(file_header) backup_size_compressed += len(compressed_block) write_queue.put(compressed_block) # Check if exclude is in filename. If it is, log the file # exclusion and continue to the next iteration. if exclude: files = [name for name in files if exclude not in name] if files: LOG.warning( ('Excluding file names matching with: ' '{}'.format(exclude))) for name in files: file_path = os.path.join(root, name) rel_path = os.path.relpath(file_path, fs_path) inode_dict_struct, inode_str_struct = \ self.get_file_struct(rel_path, new_level) if not inode_dict_struct: continue file_metadata = self.compute_incrementals( rel_path, inode_str_struct, inode_dict_struct, files_meta, compress_obj, old_fs_meta_struct, write_queue) # VERIFY THIS!!! files_meta.update(file_metadata) else: try: inode_dict_struct, inode_str_struct = self.get_file_struct( fs_path, new_level) rel_path = os.path.relpath(fs_path, fs_path) file_metadata = self.compute_incrementals( rel_path, inode_str_struct, inode_dict_struct, files_meta, compress_obj, old_fs_meta_struct, write_queue) files_meta.update(file_metadata) except (IOError, OSError) as error: LOG.warning('IO or OS Error: {}'.format(error)) if os.path.lexists(fs_path): LOG.warning('Broken link at: {}'.format(fs_path)) files_meta['broken_links'].append(fs_path) # Flush any compressed buffered data flushed_data = compress_obj.flush() if flushed_data: backup_size_compressed += len(flushed_data) write_queue.put(flushed_data) # General metrics to be uploaded to the API and/or media storage files_meta['meta']['broken_links_tot'] = len( files_meta['broken_links']) files_meta['meta']['total_files'] = len(files_meta['files']) files_meta['meta']['total_directories'] = len( files_meta['directories']) files_meta['meta']['backup_size_on_disk'] = backup_size_on_disk files_meta['meta']['backup_size_compressed'] = backup_size_compressed files_meta['meta']['rsync_data_struct_ver'] = RSYNC_DATA_STRUCT_VERSION LOG.info("Backup session metrics: {0}".format( files_meta['meta'])) # Compress meta data file # Write meta data to disk as JSON compressed_json_meta = zlib.compress(json.dumps(files_meta)) new_fs_meta_path = '{}/{}'.format(self.main_storage.work_dir, new_fs_meta) new_meta_fd = open(new_fs_meta_path, 'wb') new_meta_fd.write(compressed_json_meta) new_meta_fd.close() # Put False on the queue so it will be terminated on the other side: write_queue.put(False) @staticmethod def get_fs_meta_struct(fs_meta_path): fs_meta_struct = {} if os.path.isfile(fs_meta_path): # Here the metadata file needs to be written on blocks) fs_meta_fd = open(fs_meta_path) fs_meta_struct = json.loads(zlib.decompress(fs_meta_fd.read())) fs_meta_fd.close() return fs_meta_struct def compute_incrementals( self, rel_path, inode_str_struct, inode_dict_struct, files_meta, compress_obj, old_fs_meta_struct, write_queue): file_header = self.gen_file_header( rel_path, inode_str_struct) # File size is header size + null bytes + file size file_size = len(file_header) try: files_meta['files'][rel_path] = inode_dict_struct # Files type where the file content can be backed up if inode_dict_struct['inode']['ftype'] in REG_FILE: file_path_fd = open(rel_path, 'rb') files_meta['files'][rel_path].update( {'signature': pyrsync.blockchecksums( file_path_fd, RSYNC_BLOCK_SIZE)}) file_path_fd.close() else: # Stat the file to be sure it's not a broken link if os.path.lexists(rel_path): if not os.path.exists(rel_path): raise IOError files_meta['files'][rel_path].update( {'signature': [[], []]}) # As pyrsync functions run thorough the file descriptor # we need to set the set the pointer to the fd to 0. # Backup file data content only if the file type is # regular or unknown if old_fs_meta_struct: old_file_meta = old_fs_meta_struct['files'].get(rel_path) if old_file_meta and self.is_file_modified( old_file_meta, files_meta['files'][rel_path]): # If old_fs_path is provided, it checks # if old file mtime or ctime are different then # the new ones compressed_block = compress_obj.compress(file_header) write_queue.put(compressed_block) if inode_dict_struct['inode']['ftype'] in REG_FILE: file_path_fd = open(rel_path) for data_block in self.rsync_gen_delta( file_path_fd, old_file_meta): compressed_block = compress_obj.compress( data_block) write_queue.put(compressed_block) file_path_fd.close() else: # If old_fs_path is provided, it checks # if old file mtime or ctime are different # then the new ones compressed_block = compress_obj.compress(file_header) write_queue.put(compressed_block) if inode_dict_struct['inode']['ftype'] in REG_FILE: file_path_fd = open(rel_path) data_block = file_path_fd.read( RSYNC_BLOCK_BUFF_SIZE) while data_block: if not data_block: break compressed_block = compress_obj.compress(data_block) write_queue.put(compressed_block) data_block = file_path_fd.read( RSYNC_BLOCK_BUFF_SIZE) file_path_fd.close() files_meta['files'][rel_path]['file_data_len'] = file_size except (IOError, OSError) as error: LOG.warning('IO or OS Error: {}'.format(error)) if os.path.lexists(rel_path): LOG.warning( 'Broken link at: {}'.format(rel_path)) files_meta['broken_links'].append(rel_path) return files_meta

commit_message:
Allow 'get_all_class_names' to pass kwargs

The keyword arguments fully_qualified and truncate_builtins
are useful to allow to be passed, and are meaningful to pass
along from this function to the `get_class_name` function so
let them be passed.

Change-Id: I0787bbaf209f3c223e72214d63e006cfc1d40866
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils refs/changes/75/409375/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_all_class_names(obj, up_to=object, fully_qualified=True, truncate_builtins=True): yield get_class_name(cls, fully_qualified=fully_qualified, truncate_builtins=truncate_builtins)

commit_message:
Change network allocation of Unity driver to 1

One IP port is enough for share server created on Unity system.
This patch change the IP allocation in Unity driver from 2 to 1.

Change-Id: I3e8ea3f5fe1d3e713239d5c0fb19733abc97f5bd
Closes-Bug: 1648328

commit_message:
Remove exception from v2 validation path

In the process of refactoring most of the token provider API, I
proposed a patch that would raise an exception if a v2.0 token was
validated to prove nothing in keystone was currently validating v2.0
tokens. This commit removes the exception from the v2.0 validation
path because we will need to be able to validate v2.0 token during
and upgrade from Newton to Ocata.

The shim should remain in the token provider through-out the Ocata
release, but it can be removed as soon as Pike opens for development.
When deployments upgrade from Ocata to Pike, hopefully deployments
will no longer have any v2.0 tokens and they will all be considered
expired anyway.

Change-Id: I1e50aadee45e16b7bad64de446a6e66c6ad237da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/77/404977/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # ability for a v2.0 token to be persisted while Newton code is # remove this case, which will be in Pike.
deleted_lines: # ability for v2.0 token to be persisted while Newton code is # remove this case. I'm proposing this with an exception here # to prove the tests will pass - ultimately meaning absolutely # nothing in keystone uses this. raise Exception( 'Validating a v2.0 token! This should not happen!' ) # NOTE(lbragstad): v2.0 tokens have an `access` dictionary # instead of a `token` one. At this point we can safely assume # we are validating a token that was created using the v2.0 # API.

commit_message:
Added conditional headers to HEAD request documentation

Currently, conditional headers, e.g. If-Match, If-Modified-Since, etc.,
are listed for the GET objects API call, but not in the HEAD objects
call in the api-ref documentation.  This patch adds the missing headers
to the HEAD documentation.

Change-Id: Idd1c248cc27415d148a1b9a5eb2e95f25b8c4da0
Closes-Bug: #1630212
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/04/387204/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove floatingip address ignores ha_state

We both enables router_distributed and l3_ha in server side,
and configures L3 agent node as dvr_snat in compute nodes.
HA router removing floatingip address only in master node,
and dvr local router only remove FIP rule. This will cause
RTNETLINK error if we operates floatingip "associate --> disassociate
--> reassociate".

This patch removes floatingip address whether router's ha_state
is master or backup.
Another solution is adding remove_floating_ip in dvr_edge_router.

Change-Id: I2fab45cff786c475d69c5f0cf4e9b71e6bbbe653
Closes-Bug: #1641535
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/92/397092/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertTrue(super_remove_floating_ip.called)

commit_message:
Get rid of DVR override of remove_router_interface

This gets rid of the inheritance of remove_router_interface
in the DVR mixin and converts it to use the callback framework.

Change-Id: Iaa66549b2c49ad5fe7a2877b6fca9782630ff731

added_lines: :: git clone https://github.com/openstack/kolla cd kolla set up kolla dependcies :doc:`quickstart`to enable bifrost to be bootstrapped correctly add the deployment hosts hostname to 127.0.0.1 line e.g. :: ubuntu@bifrost:/repo/kolla$ cat /etc/hosts 127.0.0.1 bifrost localhost # The following lines are desirable for IPv6 capable hosts ::1 ip6-localhost ip6-loopback fe00::0 ip6-localnet ff00::0 ip6-mcastprefix ff02::1 ip6-allnodes ff02::2 ip6-allrouters ff02::3 ip6-allhosts 192.168.100.15 bifrost:: tox -e genconfigset install_type to source :: install_type = binary :: tools/build.py bifrost-deploy :: kolla-build bifrost-deploysee bifrost dynamic inventory examples for more details.:: :: dib_os_element: ubuntu :: tools/kolla-ansible deploy-bifrost :: kolla-ansible deploy-bifrost:: docker exec -it bifrost_deploy bash:: ssh-keygen :: cd /bifrost . env-vars . /opt/stack/ansible/hacking/env-setup cd playbooks/ :: tools/kolla-ansible deploy-servers :: kolla-ansible deploy-serversdocs: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/bifrost/ troubleshooting: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/bifrost/troubleshooting.html code: https://github.com/openstack/bifrost
deleted_lines: git clone https://github.com/openstack/kolla cd kolla set up kolla dependcies `doc`:quickstart.rstto enable bifrost to be bootstrapped correctly add the deployment hosts hostname to 127.0.0.1 line e.g. ubuntu@bifrost:/repo/kolla$ cat /etc/hosts 127.0.0.1 bifrost localhost # The following lines are desirable for IPv6 capable hosts ::1 ip6-localhost ip6-loopback fe00::0 ip6-localnet ff00::0 ip6-mcastprefix ff02::1 ip6-allnodes ff02::2 ip6-allrouters ff02::3 ip6-allhosts 192.168.100.15 bifrosttox -e genconfig set install_type to sourcetools/build.py bifrost-deploykolla-build bifrost-deploy see bifrost dynamic inventory examples for mor details.dib_os_element: ubuntu tools/kolla-ansible deploy-bifrostkolla-ansible deploy-bifrostdocker exec -it bifrost_deploy bashssh-keygencd /bifrost . env-vars . /opt/stack/ansible/hacking/env-setup cd playbooks/tools/kolla-ansible deploy-serverskolla-ansible deploy-serversBifrost ------- docs ____ http://docs.openstack.org/developer/bifrost/ troubleshooting _______________ http://docs.openstack.org/developer/bifrost/troubleshooting.html code ____ https://github.com/openstack/bifrost

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 15:12:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/545f80e935d27e0dfcd013f05cc83e3496307373', 'message': "Bump prlimit cpu time for qemu from 2 to 8

We've got user reported bugs that when opperating with slow NFS
backends with large (30+ GB) disk files, the prlimit of cpu_time 2 is
not sufficient for completing the qemu-img command.

This increases the allowed cpu timeout, as well as tweaking the error
message so that we return something more prescriptive when the
qemu-img command fails with prlimit abort.

Change-Id: I1f4549b787fd3b458e2c48a90bf80025987f08c4

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-08 15:45:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/test_images.py', 'nova/virt/images.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b78b1f8ce3aa407307a6adc5c60de1e960547897', 'message': "Bump prlimit cpu time for qemu from 2 to 8

We've got user reported bugs that when opperating with slow NFS
backends with large (30+ GB) disk files, the prlimit of cpu_time 2 is
guessed to be the issue at hand because if folks hot patch a qemu-img
that runs before the prlimitted one, the prlimitted one succeeds.

This increases the allowed cpu timeout, as well as tweaking the error
message so that we return something more prescriptive when the
qemu-img command fails with prlimit abort.

carefully crafted image that gets qemu-img to generate > 1G of json,

such, bumping it to 8 seconds shouldn't impact our protection in any

Closes-Bug: #1646181

commit_message:
Bump prlimit cpu time for qemu from 2 to 8

We've got user reported bugs that when opperating with slow NFS
backends with large (30+ GB) disk files, the prlimit of cpu_time 2 is
guessed to be the issue at hand because if folks hot patch a qemu-img
that runs before the prlimitted one, the prlimitted one succeeds.

This increases the allowed cpu timeout, as well as tweaking the error
message so that we return something more prescriptive when the
qemu-img command fails with prlimit abort.

The original bug (#1449062) the main mitigation concern here was a
carefully crafted image that gets qemu-img to generate > 1G of json,
and hence could be a node attack vector. cpu_time was never mentioned,
and I think was added originally as a belt and suspenders addition. As
such, bumping it to 8 seconds shouldn't impact our protection in any
real way.

Change-Id: I1f4549b787fd3b458e2c48a90bf80025987f08c4
Closes-Bug: #1646181
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/68/408668/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cpu_time=8, # this means we hit prlimits, make the exception more specific if exp.exit_code == -9: msg = (_("qemu-img aborted by prlimits when inspecting " "%(path)s : %(exp)s") % {'path': path, 'exp': exp}) else: msg = (_("qemu-img failed to execute on %(path)s : %(exp)s") % {'path': path, 'exp': exp})
deleted_lines: cpu_time=2, msg = (_("qemu-img failed to execute on %(path)s : %(exp)s") % {'path': path, 'exp': exp})

commit_message:
os-vif: add vif_name to VIFVHostUser class

When dealing with vhostuser ports, plugins need to know the
name of such ports in order to perform plug/unplug.
The current implementation of vhostuser ovs plug computes
this vif name directly in the plugin while this information
could be directly stored in the object class.

This patch adds this port name (vif_name) to the VIFVHostUser
class to prepare future rework of this vhostuser ovs plug and to
enable different vhostuser plug mechanisms (including fast path)
that needs this vif_name as well.

Signed-off-by: Francesco Santoro <francesco.santoro@6wind.com>

Change-Id: I45f73918d51d5fa64a0c0edd557be1fd41db55f7

subject: Process and mount default bind mounts first
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 13:31:47.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/common-tasks/os-lxc-container-setup.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/f219d90d8b85ed2c2c7a3771ee1f8143f1065fa6', 'message': 'Process and mount default bind mounts first

lxc_default_bind_mounts are now mounted before list_of_bind_mounts.
As a consequence, /var/log/ is now mounted before /var/log/log-storage/
in rsyslog containers.
Also, directory creation inside the container is now handled by LXC
(using the create=dir option) just before the directory gets mounted,
so mounting a subdirectory after a directory (such as
/var/log/log-storage/ and /var/log/) will work.

Change-Id: I29be91b4dca5abe1bb8307429a86c06dbd3ef7aa
Closes-Bug: #1648065

commit_message:
Process and mount default bind mounts first

lxc_default_bind_mounts are now mounted before list_of_bind_mounts.
As a consequence, /var/log/ is now mounted before /var/log/log-storage/
in rsyslog containers.
Also, directory creation inside the container is now handled by LXC
(using the create=dir option) just before the directory gets mounted,
so mounting a subdirectory after a directory (such as
/var/log/log-storage/ and /var/log/) will work.

Change-Id: I29be91b4dca5abe1bb8307429a86c06dbd3ef7aa
Closes-Bug: #1648065

deleted_lines: - "{{ list_of_bind_mounts | default([]) }}" delegate_to: "{{ physical_host }}" when: - not is_metal | bool - name: LXC bind mount directories lxc_container: name: "{{ inventory_hostname }}" container_command: | [[ ! -d "{{ item['bind_dir_path'] }}" ]] && mkdir -p "{{ item['bind_dir_path'] }}" with_items: - "{{ lxc_default_bind_mounts | default([]) }}" register: _bm line: "lxc.mount.entry = {{ item['mount_path'] }} {{ item['bind_dir_path'].lstrip('/') }} none bind 0 0" - "{{ list_of_bind_mounts | default([]) }}" - (_bm is defined and _bm | changed) or (_ec is defined and _ec | changed)
